page.title: 05RELIGION IN TIPTREE
page.content: SAINT LUKE'S CHURCH OF ENGLAND The Church of Saint Luke's, Tiptree was consecrated on October 17th 1856.(This is the eve of Saint Luke's Day).The parish was not created until November 11th 1858.The church cost Â£1800 and was funded by the local people.It was built on land given by the Lord of the Manor, The Earl of Verulam.The first rector was The Reverend W. Frend. The church is brick built and consists of a chancel, nave and aisles and a tower with one bell. In 1927 an appeal was launched for Â£594 to repair the roof.The church members were asked to pay at least a shilling(5p) a week for ten weeks. In 1974 a multi_purpose hall was built on to the church which is used by the Church School and clubs and organisations.
